FuncDef:
The radius-server cache keep packet command disables the device from deleting cached accounting packets after the number of retransmissions reaches the specified upper limit.
The undo radius-server cache keep packet command restores the default configuration.
By default, cached accounting packets are deleted after the number of retransmissions reaches the specified upper limit.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After the function to cache accounting packets is enable on a device, if the device is disconnected from the RADIUS server during the user login process, accounting packets are cached. By default, cached accounting packets are deleted after the number of retransmissions reaches the specified upper limit. To disable the device from deleting cached accounting packets after the number of retransmissions reaches the specified upper limit, run the radius-server cache keep packet command.
Prerequisites
The function to cache accounting packets has been enabled.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
